titleStmt.title: འཕགས་པ་ངན་སོང་ཐམས་ཅད་ཡོངས་སུ་སྦྱོང་བ་གཟི་བརྗིད་ཀྱི་རྒྱལ་པོ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ཆོ་ག་ཞིབ་མོའི་རྒྱལ་པོ་ཆེན་པོའི་རྒྱ་ཆེར་འགྲེལ་པ།
'phags pa ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba gzi brjid kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po chen po'i rgya cher 'grel pa/
Ārya­sarvadurgati­pariśodhana­tejorāja­nāma­mahākalpa­rājasya ṭīkā
An Extensive Commentary on the Great King of Subtle Yoga Rituals called “The Radiant King of the Purification of All Bad Transmigrations”

bibl.author: dzA lan+d+ha ra'i rdo rje slob dpon kA ma deha nu pa zhes bya ba'i zhal snga nas
Vinayacandra
bod kyi lo tsa ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab

notesStmt.note: Last updated at 07/09/2018 at 10:17:57 by admin

Sa-skya Rje-btsun Grags-pa-rgyal-mtshan (1147-1216) maintains that none of the canonical commentaries on the Sarvadurgatipariśodhana Tantra were translated from Sanskrit, but were all original Tibetan compositions.
